attributes.action: STOP Stoke-on-Trent City Council passing the charges of equal pay on to City Schools
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
As schools within the City we are all working hard to improve attainment for all the children in Stoke-on-Trent.
There is now no capacity to improve as we will have huge equal pay charges taken from our budgets without notice.  This could be up to £250,000 in some schools.
Whilst we fully support our colleagues and agree that this is money that they are entitled to. We do not believe it is legitimate or lawful to charge schools this back pay.
The school is not the respondent for equal pay claims, the local authority is.

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "STOP Stoke-on-Trent City Council passing the charges of equal pay on to City Schools."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here:
